name: Greater Sphinx
description: The Greater Sphinx is a colossal creature with a powerful, lion-like body and a humanoid head, often adorned with fine jewelry that showcases its noble and magical heritage.
memorable: Its ability to see through illusions and its devastating roar make it an imposing presence.
goals: Guard ancient wisdom or treasures and provide challenges to worthy adventurers.
relations: May be encountered alongside other magical guardians or beings of ancient lore.
environment: Typically found in ancient ruins, temples, or other locations of significant historical and magical importance.
strengths: Immunity to psychic damage and damage from nonmagical weapons, as well as immunities to various conditions.
weaknesses: Average Dexterity makes it less evasive against physical attacks.
attacks: Multiattack allows for two powerful claw attacks dealing significant slashing damage, with a devastating magical roar that capitalizes on sound-based fear tactics.
most_powerful_ability: The roar ability, which escalates in power with each use, allowing it to inflict fear, paralyze, and deal significant thunder damage.
senses: Possesses truesight with a range of 120 feet, allowing it to see through illusions.
skills: Notably skilled in arcana, history, religion, and perception, making it highly knowledgeable.
additional_information: Innate spellcasting with a focus on Wisdom-based spells
Legendary Resistance allows it to endure critical moments in combat
Can transport up to eight willing creatures to different locations or planes
Immunity to divination magic via Inscrutable ability
Ability to double its speed temporarily boosts its combat efficiency
spellcasting: Can cast a variety of spells at will and several times per day, enhancing its versatility in combat and utility.
test_queries: powerful guardian that uses thunder magic
creature with truesight and fear-inducing roar
magic user that can teleport with its allies
intelligent lion-headed giant that guards treasures
fortified beast immune to psychic damage
